alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 1:10PM EST until March 08 at 2:03PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Haw Creek near Clifford. Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. .Rainfall amounts of around one and a half to two and a half inches across much of central Indiana is producing minor flooding along many area rivers, streams and creeks, including Haw Creek near Clifford which should crest later this evening and fall below flood late tonight. The Mississinewa River near Ridgeville should crest late this afternoon but moderate flooding should continue in that area into the overnight hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, State Road 1 south of the intersection with SR 28 in western Randolph County is impassable. Extensive agricultural flooding in progress. At least a few county roads flooded including West CR 825 east of SR 1 and West River Road west of SR 1. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EST Monday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.6 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening.
